movies.title: Cabin Fever 2: Spring Fever
movies.plot: A high school prom faces a deadly threat: a flesh-eating virus that spreads via a popular brand of bottled water.
movies.simplePlot: A high school prom faces a deadly threat: a flesh-eating virus that spreads via a popular brand of bottled water.

biography.bio: Rider Strong was born on December 11, 1979 in San Francisco, California, USA as Rider King Strong. He is an actor and director, known for Boy Meets World (1993), Cabin Fever (2002) and The Dungeon Master (2011). He has been married to Alexandra Barreto since October 20, 2013. They have one child.
biography.name: Rider Strong

biography.placeOfBirth: New York City, New York, USA
biography.bio: Noah Segan was born on October 5, 1983 in New York City, New York, USA. He is an actor and producer, known for Looper (2012), Brick (2005) and Deadgirl (2008).
biography.name: Noah Segan

biography.bio: Alexi Wasser was born on February 11, 1981 in Los Angeles, California, USA as Alexi Celine Wasser. She is an actress and producer, known for Cabin Fever 2: Spring Fever (2009), Return to Sender (2015) and Choose (2011).
biography.name: Alexi Wasser

biography.bio: Rusty Kelley is an actor and director, known for Cabin Fever 2: Spring Fever (2009), Dear Pillow (2004) and The Garage (2006).
biography.name: Rusty Kelley

biography.bio: Marc Senter is an actor and producer, known for Red White & Blue (2010), The Lost (2006) and Starry Eyes (2014).
biography.name: Marc Senter

biography.bio: Giuseppe Andrews was born in Key Largo, Florida. His real name is Joey Andrews, but as he grew up he thought his name sounded too young and changed it to Giuseppe after Italian composer Giuseppe Verdi. After his parents divorced, Andrews became interested in acting. He and his father moved to Los Angeles because of his father's work, and for a time lived in a van. One day he saw an ad in a magazine for auditions for an agency and decided to go for it. He was signed up and says that it was really hard to get into the industry, but he was very lucky. Since that time he has been in many films, television movies and programs, and music videos. He is best known as his role for Lex in Detroit Rock City (1999) and for his role as Germ on the TV series Two Guys, a Girl and a Pizza Place (1998). He can also be seen in Smashing Pumpkins "1979" music video and their "Perfect" music video. His next goal is to be more involved behind a camera, like writing and directing his own films. He also writes music and hopes to combine them into his future films, too.
biography.name: Giuseppe Andrews

biography.bio: Mark Borchardt was born and raised in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. He started making films at the age of fourteen with a super-8 camera that he bought from a garage sale for $40. After serving three years in the military he continued his cinematic endeavors at the local university. In the mid-nineties he wrote and produced Halloween radio dramas which were broadcast annually and won a fellowship from the Milwaukee Art Futures Board. Getting nowhere fast on the film front he decided to make a short horror film entitled, Coven (2000). He spent the next three and a half years writing, shooting and editing a troublesome project. This struggle was documented in _American Movie: The Making of Northwestern (1999)_, which was picked up by Sony Classics and won the Grand Jury Prize at the 1999 Sundance Film Festival. Since then Mark has made five appearances on Late Show with David Letterman (1993) and has appeared in several movies including _One, The (2001/I)_ with Jet Li and The Tunnel (2001) with Lloyd Kaufman. He has contributed to the forthcoming book, "The Independent Film Experience" and is beginning to get his short stories published in magazines. Currently he is working on his lifelong film, "Northwestern", which will be out in 2004.
biography.name: Mark Borchardt

biography.bio: Michael Bowen was born on June 21, 1953 in Houston, Texas, USA as Michael Bowen Jr. He is an actor, known for Kill Bill: Vol. 2 (2004), Kill Bill: Vol. 1 (2003) and Django Unchained (2012).
biography.name: Michael Bowen

biography.bio: Judah Friedlander was born on March 16, 1969 in Gaithersburg, Maryland, USA. He is an actor, known for 30 Rock (2006), The Wrestler (2008) and Star Wars: The Force Awakens (2015).
biography.name: Judah Friedlander

biography.placeOfBirth: New York City, New York, USA
biography.bio: Larry Fessenden was born on March 23, 1963 in New York City, New York, USA. He is an actor and producer, known for Habit (1995), The Last Winter (2006) and I Sell the Dead (2008).
biography.name: Larry Fessenden

biography.bio: Amanda Jelks began performing at an early age, singing and dancing. When she was 9, she was offered an acting part in a local musical production, then she was hooked. She played the lead in several productions in school and community Theatre (Penny - "You Can't Take It With You," Mrs. Hoopway - "Beauty Pageant,"Etc.), then auditioned for the prestigious New Orleans Center of the Creative Arts, where she was offered a full scholarship. She studied Drama and Musical Theatre at NOCCA, while attending Hammond High School. She is the daughter of Melissa Miller and Rodney Jelks. She has two sisters, Jessica (older) and Abigail (younger) and one brother, Jamie (younger). After Hurricane Katrina, Amanda attended two years at The University of New Orleans' Drama Program. She recently filmed Cabin Fever 2 and is auditioning for NYU's Stella Adler Conservitory.
biography.name: Amanda Jelks

biography.bio: Thomas Blake was raised on a small island in North Carolina named Wrightsville Beach, on the outskirts of Wilmington. At an early age he became interested in acting and began doing community theater whenever he could. After two years in UNC Wilmington's Theater Dept. he moved to New York City to study acting at Uta Hagen's conservatory HB Studios. While in NYC he continued doing theater, started starring in indie films as well began directing both theater and film. In 2007 he moved to LA to direct, produce, and star in a theater production called Point Break Live! His work both as an actor and director on PBL garnered him major critical praise, including being named one of LA Weekly's People of the Year in 2009, and is still playing in Los Angeles making it the city's longest running show. PBL has since played in San Francisco, Vegas, NYC, Chicago and many other cities across the US. In 2011 he wrote and directed Terminator Too Judgment Play which has also seen great critical praise and has been playing in NYC, Los Angeles, and San Francisco ever since. In 2014 both PBL and Terminator Too played Bonnaroo Music Festival making them the first two theater shows to ever play at a major US music festival. Although busy with his theater productions Thomas continues to work in film in TV regularly. He strives to remain diverse in his quest to produce quality, truthful forms of entertainment whether in front of or behind the lens or curtain. Thomas is the owner of On The Fly Productions which produces all forms of entertainment from live theater to feature films.
biography.name: Thomas Blake Jr.

biography.bio: Born and raised in Springville, Utah, Angela Brown was welcomed into a large family, she's the fourth oldest of nineteen children by the same mother and father. Her early years included farming, gardening, a decade of home school, and family musical performances at local churches and gathering spots. Growing up, Angela was very athletic, involved in gymnastics, and swimming and later became a competitive marathon runner and triathlete. After high school Angela moved to Charlotte, North Carolina where she took a job as a professional nanny and raised children while she pursued a higher education. From there she transitioned as an entrepreneur into a professional corporate trainer, training commissioned salespeople worldwide on wellness and balanced living. "Words of Wellness" became a radio show and newspaper column with Angela as writer, producer, and show host. It was the research for a newspaper article on the physiology of emotions that led her to acting, and landed her on a movie set as an extra in "The Ultimate Gift". Angela pursued acting in North Carolina through a series of small roles in independent films until joining the Screen Actors Guild in the spring of 2007. Acting classes and auditions led her from Charlotte to New York, and eventually to Los Angeles where she currently resides.
biography.name: Angela Oberer

biography.bio: Taylor Kowalski was born on July 5, 1988 in Van Nuys, California, USA. He is an actor and producer, known for Homeland (2011), The Detour (2016) and Snowfall (2017).
biography.name: Taylor Kowalski

biography.bio: Alexander Isaiah Thomas is a SAG-AFTRA Actor. He started his career in show business at the young age of five while living in Virginia. He was home-schooled. Alexander was discovered by a talent agency in North Carolina while participating in an extensive workshop in Greensboro, North Carolina.
biography.name: Alexander Isaiah Thomas
